app.title: GEO Page Analysis
app.subtitle: Analyze how AI may interpret this page
landing.hero.tagline: Let AI Understand and Cite Your Content
landing.hero.subtitle: Check if your pages are ready to be cited by ChatGPT, Claude, Perplexity, and other AI systems
landing.features.title: What We Check For You
landing.feature1.title: AI Crawler Access
landing.feature1.desc: Detect whether major AI crawlers (GPTBot, ClaudeBot, PerplexityBot) can access your content through robots.txt and meta tags analysis.
landing.feature2.title: Content Structure Analysis
landing.feature2.desc: Evaluate your page structure including headings, lists, tables, and Schema.org to help AI better understand and cite your content.
landing.feature3.title: Actionable Recommendations
landing.feature3.desc: Get specific, prioritized suggestions to improve your GEO score with step-by-step guidance.
landing.stats.note: Free and open source. No registration required.
loading.title: Preparing analysis
loading.disclaimer.line2: This does not reflect actual computation progress.
result.title: Analysis Result
result.section.surface.note: Indicates how many structural anchors AI systems can rely on when interpreting this page.
result.section.implications: What this implies for AI-generated answers
result.meta.title: Title
surface.heading: Headings
tooltip.surface_size.1: Counts how many structural anchors AI systems can rely on when interpreting this page.
tooltip.surface_size.2: Pages with more structural anchors are easier for AI to decompose and cite accurately.
tooltip.surface_size.3: Calculated from headings, paragraphs, lists, and tables extracted from the main content.
tooltip.structural_diversity.1: Shows how many different structural types appear in this page.
tooltip.structural_diversity.2: Low structural diversity often leads AI to produce high-level conceptual summaries.
tooltip.structural_diversity.3: Based on the presence of headings, paragraphs, lists, and tables.
tooltip.definition_presence.1: Indicates whether clear definition-like statements exist on this page.
tooltip.definition_presence.2: Explicit definitions help AI identify what an entity or concept actually refers to.
tooltip.definition_presence.3: Detected using rule-based patterns commonly found in definition sentences.
tooltip.enumeratable_facts.1: Shows whether list or table structures support enumerating facts.
tooltip.enumeratable_facts.2: Enumeratable structures help AI cite discrete items instead of summarizing broadly.
tooltip.enumeratable_facts.3: Based on the presence of lists or tables in the main content.
tooltip.reference_structures.1: Indicates whether reference-like structures are present.
tooltip.reference_structures.2: Reference structures make AI more likely to cite precise items.
tooltip.reference_structures.3: Detected by the presence of tables in the main content.
tooltip.conceptual_tendency.1: Indicates whether the structure leans conceptual or fact-based.
tooltip.conceptual_tendency.2: Structure influences whether AI produces conceptual summaries or fact lists.
tooltip.conceptual_tendency.3: Based on the presence of lists or tables versus narrative-only content.
tooltip.summary_behavior.1: Describes the likely summarization behavior given this structure.
tooltip.summary_behavior.2: Helps anticipate whether AI will enumerate facts or summarize concepts.
tooltip.summary_behavior.3: Derived from the mix of headings with list or table structures.
tooltip.usage_profile: This usage profile describes how AI is likely to use this page based on structural signals, not content quality or value judgment.
tooltip.rule_hints: These signals illustrate why the system leans toward a certain AI usage type. They are indicative patterns, not strict rules.
tooltip.blockers: These blockers indicate structural factors that make AI less likely to cite this page, not errors in the content itself.
tooltip.fixes: These structural fixes directly address the detected blockers and aim to improve how AI can use the content.
tooltip.crawler_access: This section checks whether known AI crawlers are explicitly allowed to access the content. It does not guarantee how the content will be used.
tooltip.schema_org: Schema.org structured data helps search engines and AI systems better understand the semantic meaning and structure of page content.
tooltip.readability: Readability metrics assess how easy content is to read. Higher readability helps AI understand and summarize content more accurately.
tooltip.quotable: These sentences are highly likely to be quoted by AI, typically containing clear facts, definitions, or statistics.
rule_hints.lists_tables: Lists or tables used to enumerate facts
rule_hints.entity_explanations: Clear entity mentions with nearby explanations
structural_fixes.add_fact_list: Add a fact list or comparison table (5–8 items).
structural_fixes.add_h_framing: Add a clear H1/H2 framing section and a concise meta description.
example.label: Example from this page
example.none: No example detected on this page.
example.enumeration_absent: No list or table structures detected that AI can enumerate.
ai.summary.mixed: Likely to mix concepts with key facts
result.word_count.label: Word count (technical reference)
result.word_count.note: Reflects raw extracted text units, not human-perceived content length.
input.section.title: Representative extracted content
input.section.note.line1: This excerpt is shown for transparency only,
input.section.note.line2: not as the basis of the analysis.
input.download.note.line1: This file represents the structured input provided to AI systems,
history.title: Analysis History
issue.noindex_set: Page has noindex set, AI may not index
issue.no_lists: No enumerable list or table structures
issue.has_lists: Contains list or table structures for AI citation
summary.excellent: This page is highly AI-friendly with excellent structure and citation potential.
summary.good: This page has good AI friendliness with minor optimization opportunities.
summary.moderate: This page has moderate AI friendliness. Consider adding more structured content.
summary.needs_work: This page needs structural improvements for better AI accessibility.
summary.poor: This page is not AI-friendly and requires significant structural and accessibility improvements.
schema.has_faq: Contains FAQPage schema for Q&A citations
schema.has_howto: Contains HowTo schema for step-by-step citations
schema.has_article: Contains Article schema for content identification
guide.blocked_by_robots.desc: Your robots.txt file is blocking AI crawlers from reading your content. This prevents AI from citing your website.
guide.blocked_by_robots.solution: Add these rules to robots.txt to allow AI crawlers:
guide.blocked_by_robots.code:
User-agent: GPTBot
Allow: /

User-agent: ClaudeBot
Allow: /

User-agent: PerplexityBot
Allow: /
guide.no_robots_txt.desc: No robots.txt file found. While AI crawlers usually allow access by default, explicit settings ensure your intent is understood.
guide.no_robots_txt.solution: Create a robots.txt file in your website root:
guide.noindex_set.desc: The page has noindex set in meta tags. AI may skip indexing this page.
guide.noindex_set.solution: If you want AI to cite this page, remove the noindex setting:
guide.no_schema.desc: No Schema.org structured data detected. Structured data helps AI accurately identify your content type and key information.
guide.low_diversity.desc: Page structure is uniform, mainly consisting of plain text paragraphs. AI finds it harder to extract citable information.
guide.low_diversity.tips:
• Use lists to enumerate key points
• Use tables for comparison data
• Add clear heading hierarchy (H2, H3)
• Provide definition statements
guide.no_definitions.desc: No explicit definition statements found. Definitions help AI understand what concepts you're discussing.
guide.no_definitions.tips:
• "[Term] is defined as..."
• "[Term] refers to..."
• "[Term] is a type of..."
guide.low_readability.desc: Content readability is low, possibly due to long sentences or complex vocabulary. This affects AI comprehension accuracy.
guide.low_readability.tips:
• Break long sentences into shorter ones
• Use more common vocabulary
• Focus each paragraph on one point
• Add transition sentences
guide.no_lists.desc: Page lacks list or table structures. These structures help AI cite specific items more easily.
guide.no_lists.solution: Consider converting key information to list format:
guide.no_lists.tips:
• Step instructions → Numbered lists
• Feature listings → Bullet lists
• Comparison data → Tables
crawler.intro: AI crawlers are programs used by AI companies to read web content. Allowing crawler access gives your content a chance to be cited by AI.
readability.flesch.label: Readability Score
readability.flesch.note: 0-100 scale, higher is easier. 60+ is suitable for general audience.
readability.grade.label: Grade Level
readability.grade.note: Education level required. Number = grade level. 8-9 is suitable for general readers.
readability.time.label: Est. Reading Time
score.intro: GEO Score measures how AI-friendly your page is. Higher scores mean AI can better understand and cite your content.
score.accessibility.note: Can AI crawlers access your content
score.structure.note: Is content structure clear and parseable
score.quality.note: Is content quality suitable for AI citation
breakdown.accessibility.tip: Whether AI crawlers can successfully read your webpage
breakdown.structure.tip: Whether your page has clear headings, paragraphs, lists, etc.
breakdown.quality.tip: Whether content is readable, valuable, and suitable for AI citation
tooltip.content_health: How AI interprets your content type and how much effective content it can read
tooltip.optimization: Specific improvements that can effectively boost AI friendliness
optimization.none_needed: No urgent improvements needed. Great job!
level3.title: AI Brand Visibility Monitoring
level3.intro: Next-level feature: Track your brand's visibility in AI responses
level3.feature1.title: Multi-Engine Brand Monitoring
level3.feature1.desc: Periodic queries to ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Perplexity to detect brand mentions and recommendations
level3.feature2.title: Time-Series Reports
level3.feature2.desc: Track brand exposure trends, competitor comparison, AI crawler behavior analysis
level3.feature3.title: Bring Your Own Key (BYOK)
level3.feature3.desc: Use your own API keys for full cost control and better data security
level3.cta: This feature is in development. Contact us for early access or partnership opportunities.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
history.subtitle: Last 20 analysis records
history.subtitle_local: Your analysis records in this browser (stored locally)
history.empty_local: No records yet (records are stored in your browser only)
history.clear_confirm: Are you sure you want to clear all history?
compare.title: Compare URLs
compare.subtitle: Compare 2-3 URLs side-by-side to see which page is more AI-friendly
compare.tips.title: Tips for effective comparison
compare.tips.tip1: Compare your page with a competitor's similar page
compare.tips.tip2: Compare different versions of the same page
compare.loading.title: Analyzing URLs...
compare.loading.note1: We're analyzing each page for AI friendliness.
compare.token_expired: Your session expired. Please try again.
compare.results.title: Comparison Results
compare.partial_errors: Some URLs could not be analyzed
tooltip.geo_score: Overall AI-friendliness score (0-100). Higher means AI can better understand and cite your content.
tooltip.grade: Letter grade based on GEO score. A=Excellent, B=Good, C=Average, D=Poor, F=Needs work.
tooltip.accessibility: Can AI crawlers access your content? Checks robots.txt permissions for GPTBot, ClaudeBot, etc.
tooltip.structure: Is your content well-organized? Evaluates headings, lists, and semantic HTML structure.
tooltip.quality: Content quality signals: word count, readability, entity density, and factual statements.
tooltip.ai_crawlers: Number of major AI crawlers (GPTBot, ClaudeBot, PerplexityBot, Google-Extended) allowed by robots.txt.
tooltip.readability_flesch: Flesch Reading Ease score. Higher = easier to read. 60-70 is ideal for general audience.
tooltip.reading_grade: US grade level needed to understand the text. Lower is more accessible.
tooltip.word_count: Total words in main content. AI prefers comprehensive content (500+ words for articles).
tooltip.headings: Number of heading elements (H1-H6). Good structure helps AI understand content hierarchy.
tooltip.paragraphs: Number of paragraph blocks. Well-structured paragraphs improve content clarity.
tooltip.entities: Named entities (people, places, organizations) detected. More entities = richer context for AI.
tooltip.citation_potential: How likely AI will cite this content. Based on factual statements, data, and authority signals.
tooltip.qa_structure: Does content follow Q&A format? Q&A structured content is highly favored by AI for direct answers.
tooltip.deep_hierarchy: Does content have deep heading structure (H3+)? Deep hierarchy signals comprehensive coverage.
tooltip.schema_types: Schema.org structured data types found. Helps AI understand content type and context.
